newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft treasurer Greg Maffei to become CFO.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft treasurer Greg Maffei to become CFO.

text.p: Microsoft Corp. on Thursday announced that its treasurer, Greg Maffei, will become chief financial officer effective July 24, succeeding Mike Brown, who will retire at the end of the year.
Maffei, 37, vice president of corporate development, has served as Microsoft treasurer since 1994 after joining the company in 1993.

Brown, 51, has been with Microsoft since 1989. He will work on several company projects during the remainder of his tenure and will devote time to his role as chairman of the board of the Nasdaq stock market, Microsoft said.
